content:
Does anyone here have any insight into this issue? https://github.com/leanprover-community/docgen-action/issues/20 I'd love to figure this out then improve the developer experience for deploying docs sites on .github.io.

  • I got the job to succeed when ./home_page/_config.yml did not have the real URLs in it, so the job succeeded but the .github.io/<repo-name> site was 404.
  • when i added the URLs to the _config.yml file, the job failed again wiht the same can't find Gemfile or .bundle/ error that it was failing with before i ran jekyll new.
there's more oddity around the existence of the docbuild dir, where the successful run didn't have docbuild/references.bib but later runs failed because it wasn't in there.

The references issues is because of a recent PR I made to docgen-action that apparently is not properly interacting with the cache.

Other projects have temporarily pinned a prior version to avoid this issue, see https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/423402-PrimeNumberTheorem.2B/topic/CI.20issues/near/569041527

thanks for the pointer. That pin gets it to build! but i'm back to 404ing on for-all-dev.github.io/formal-CuTe

404

File not found

The site configured at this address does not contain the requested file.

If this is your site, make sure that the filename case matches the URL as well as any file permissions.
For root URLs (like http://example.com/) you must provide an index.html file.

Read the full documentation for more information about using GitHub Pages.

The references.bib issue has been fixed - we updated the doc-gen4 v4.28.0-rc1 tag to include the fix from https://github.com/leanprover/doc-gen4/pull/354.

Projects on Lean toolchain v4.28.0-rc1 or later should now work without needing an empty references.bib file. For older toolchains, the workaround is to create an empty references.bib in your repo root.

The Gemfile issue is separate - it happens when docgen-action detects a docs folder and tries to run Jekyll, but there's no Jekyll site there. Either set build-page: false in the action inputs, or set up a proper Jekyll site with jekyll new docs.
